Speaker: zeke
Dialogue: Sump'n's stirrin' up the chickens, Maude.

Speaker: maude
Dialogue: Jes' set easy, Zeke.  I'll take a look-see.

Speaker: maude
Dialogue: What's got you girls so durned upset? There a coyote sneakin' 'round?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: And Winston's in the kitchen doing your dishes.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Thanks, Slimer.  I really needed that!

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: Calm down... Where are you?...  We'll be right there.

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: Ready for this one?  Some farmer says his wife was eaten by a giant chicken.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Hey, even a half-baked false alarm sounds better than doing Egon's chores.  Let's roll!

Speaker: egon
Dialogue: I think I've finally perfected it.  Watch this, guys.  Guys?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: It sure feels strange not having Egon with us.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Why?  Lately even when he's with us, he's not with us.

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: But wouldn't it be somethin' if he sells that weather balloon idea of his?  He'll be a rich man!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Good.  Then he can hire a maid to do his share of the chores.

Speaker: zeke
Dialogue: Had big blood-red eyes, it did.  Biggest dang chicken I ever seen.  Mebbe six feet tall.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Did it have any distinguishing marks?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: This one's easy, guys.  Old Zeke's been watchin' too many horror movies and eating too much greasy popcorn.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: No, Peter, I think we're dealing with a bonafide werechicken here.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: What'd I tell you, Peter?  A werechicken egg!  Gimme a hand, Winston!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Look, if this is a werechicken egg,

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: Let's get it back to Headquarters and run some tests.  Then maybe we'll have some answers.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Oh no, I'm not leavin'.  The werechicken that laid this has gotta be around here someplace -- and I'm gonna find it.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Yo, balloon man, we've got some real work for you:  How about analyzing this?

Speaker: egon
Dialogue: Interesting.  That's the second biggest egg I've ever seen.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I don't wanna hear about it, Egon.  We've had a long night in a not-too-fragrant barnyard, so I'm taking a shower and hitting the sheets.

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: Ray, it's gettin' pretty late.  Maybe there really isn't any...

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: It's in here -- I can feel it.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Well, that takes care of one werechicken.

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: Ray, I just had a thought...

Speaker: egon
Dialogue: Thanks for the help, Slimer, but I don't have time to examine this egg tonight.  I have to prepare for my weather balloon demonstration tomorrow morning.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Well, Slimer, I don't see anything here that looks like a monster.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: What'd you do to Egon, you bird-brain!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: What's wrong with you guys?  That thing ate Egon!

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Peter, that is Egon!  The egg hatched, he was bitten and now he's a werechicken!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Come to think of it, there was a certain resemblance.

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: What happened?  He's so quiet all of a sudden.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Ray, what's this have to do with Egon being a chicken?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Werechickens only appear during a full moon, and for the next few minutes, the moon's not full.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Sit down, Egon, we have some good news and some bad news.

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: You've been turned into a werechicken!

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: That egg Peter brought in, it hatched and...

Speaker: egon
Dialogue: I remember the bite clearly.  How long will I stay like this?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: According to this, there is an antidote. But we've gotta move fast -- the eclipse only lasts three minutes!

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: "One tablespoon paprika, one clove of garlic, some parsley for color, cup of gelatin..."

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Then we've gotta go with this!  C'mon!

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: The potion only partly worked, because of the missing chickenbane.

Speaker: egon
Dialogue: Don't get your feathers ruffled, Peter. There's a logical solution to every problem.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: The werechicken that bit Egon.  It's still out there somewhere.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: All quiet on the chicken front.  How about down there?

Speaker: box boy
Dialogue: It's in there!  A big chicken!  It's gotta be ten feet tall!

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: How could we lose a fifteen foot-tall chicken?

Speaker: butcher
Dialogue: A giant chicken just came through here -- it was thirty feet tall!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Ray, you were right!  The chicken's here, and he's a walking high-rise!

Speaker: egon
Dialogue: It's a long story, Janine.   Can you get my coat, please?  I'm due at the weather board in forty-five...  ...minutes.

Speaker: janine
Dialogue: Are you sure you wanna go to a meeting like -- this?

Speaker: egon
Dialogue: Trust me.  I'm of sound mind at least.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: It's heading down 34th toward the Empire State Building.

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: Trap's full!  Somebody forgot to empty it!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: So how're we gonna, put that big bird on ice, guys'

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Peter, that's not a bed idea!  Chicken freezes at very low temperatures!

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: Yeah, but how do you freeze a 50-foot chicken in August?

Speaker: egon
Dialogue: Distinguished members of the Weather Board, my weather balloon has the clu-cluck-clu- capability --

Speaker: egon
Dialogue: I, er, can explain this, but --

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Egon, can we freeze that big chicken with your weather balloons

Speaker: egon
Dialogue: Yes, but you'll have to work the controls.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: It looks like it's about to lay an --

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: I don't want to hear it.

Speaker: egon
Dialogue: Okay, Peter, the balloon's in position. Turn the lever to the extreme left.

Speaker: egon
Dialogue: I'm actually starting to like it.

Speaker: maude
Dialogue: No more werechicken problems for us, eh, Egon?

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: It's just Slimer groovin' to his new James Brown tape.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Tell me, how do I get out of this chicken outfit?
